title: Putin proposes to restart direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on May 15
summary: The Russian president's remarks came after European leaders threatened to exert pressure on Putin if he does not accept an unconditional 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine. Furthermore, should Russia violate the truce, Putin can expect 'massive' and 'coordinated' sanctions from Europe and the US.

title: The Redwans' suspended life in the West Bank: 'We drink, we eat, we cry. We drink, we eat, we bury'
summary: Following the terrorist attacks by Hamas on October 7, 2023, M Le magazine du Monde published profiles of two families caught in the conflict: the Weissmanns, on the Israeli side, and the Redwans, on the Palestinian side. After a year and a half of a never-ending war, with the Gaza Strip under further bombardment, we spoke with them again.

title: In Israel, the Weissmanns are back in their home but disillusioned: 'There was a time when we were idealists'
summary: Following Hamas's terrorist attacks on October 7, 2023, Le Monde published profiles of two families caught in the conflict: the Weissmanns, on the Israeli side, and the Redwans, on the Palestinian side. After a year and a half of a never-ending war, with the Gaza Strip under further bombardment, we spoke with them again.

title: Should screens be banned for 6-year-olds? Even if this seems 'unrealistic,' there are 'protective factors'
summary: Some healthcare professionals recommend banning screens for children under 6 years old. Psychiatrist Serge Tisseron acknowledges in an op-ed for Le Monde that strict prohibition may seem difficult to implement but suggests some precautions that, in his view, could limit the risks of screentime.

title: India claims Pakistan violated ceasefire, says it has retaliated
summary: The two neighbors had earlier on Saturday agreed to a ceasefire after days of deadly cross-border attacks.

title: In French families, equality between fathers and mothers is still far from the norm
summary: The first nationwide survey dedicated to children's environments shows that men only participate in 30% of parenting tasks two months after birth. The situation is even bleaker when it comes to domestic work.

title: Pope Leo XIV lays out vision of his papacy, identifies AI as a main challenge
summary: Addressing a meeting of cardinals two days after being elected the 267th pope, Leo XIV pledged to follow Francis's legacy, uphold social justice and confront the ethical challenges posed by artificial intelligence and modern labor shifts.

title: Trump hails US-China tariff talks a 'total reset'
summary: Senior officials from Washington and Beijing met on Saturday, May 10, for the first time since Trump's sweeping tariffs, seeking to ease tensions amid soaring levies that threaten to upend the global economy.

title: Quebec mandates the use of the formal French 'vous' in schools
summary: A Quebec government plan to 'reinforce civility' in schools has mandated that students and teachers use formal French pronoun in both private and public schools. The change has been met with mixed feelings among teachers.

title: The main challenges awaiting Pope Leo XIV
summary: The most immediate task for Francis's successor is to continue the works of the synod on synodality, the major assembly that, in 2023 and 2024, considered the future of a more inclusive Church.

title: France and Poland sign reciprocal defense treaty that 'learns from history'
summary: The two countries pledged mutual assistance in the event of armed aggression on their territory. Emmanuel Macron specified that this commitment covers 'all military components.'

title: Donald Trump angers Iranians by considering renaming the Persian Gulf
summary: The American president, set to visit Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates from May 12 to May 15, is reportedly considering referring to it as the 'Arabian Gulf.'

title: Chinese-made prom dresses trapped in US-China trade war
summary: Pretty Lady, a Chinese company specializing in evening gowns, based in Chaozhou, Guangdong, sees half of its production sold in the United States. Now, it is being severely affected by American tariffs.

title: In Romania, as the presidential runoff approaches, 'the people have awoken'
summary: Leading the first round of the presidential election on May 4, the far-right candidate, George Simion, is capitalizing on the Social Democrats' discredit.

title: 'What we are witnessing is an absolute disgrace': EU leaders condemn situation in Gaza, but remain divided on Israel
summary: As Israel's humanitarian blockade of Gaza continues after two months, European Union foreign ministers, gathered in Warsaw on Thursday, did not have strong enough words to describe the situation on the ground.

title: Europe approves creation of tribunal to judge 'crimes of aggression' committed by Russia in Ukraine
summary: The tribunal, supported by about 35 countries, is expected to be established within the framework of the Council of Europe and could only prosecute Vladimir Putin once he has left office.

title: Power outage in Spain and Portugal: A publicity boost for Starlink
summary: On April 28, during the unprecedented blackout on the Iberian Peninsula, subscribers to Elon Musk's company's satellite connection boasted about their unaffected internet access.

title: Vladimir Putin's Red Square parade celebrates the offensive in Ukraine
summary: Soldiers and weaponry from the Ukrainian front were featured in the parade to honor the 80th anniversary of Nazi Germany's surrender, attended by international leaders like China's Xi Jinping.

title: Change the image, not the wine: How Bordeaux châteaux plan to come out of a sales crisis
summary: Le Monde spoke with Bordeaux winemakers and experts across the wine region. They are determined to change their fundamentals to regain their customers.

title: European leaders in Kyiv press Russia to accept 30-day unconditional ceasefire
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron said Saturday that Russia would face 'massive' coordinated European and US sanctions if it broke the proposed 30-day ceasefire.

title: Ukraine and allies demand 30-day ceasefire from Russia, Putin ignores them and proposes direct talks with Kyiv
summary: French, German, British and Polish leaders, welcomed by Volodymyr Zelensky in the Ukrainian capital on Saturday, have claimed the backing of US President Donald Trump to increase pressure on the Russian president.

title: Maxime Rovère, philosopher: 'Visiting your mother can become a metaphysical gift'
summary: The author of philosophical essays summons the Pythagoreans and the cosmos to present an original reflection on the bond between mother and child, which has never taken up so much space in our lives.

title: 'Leo XIV faces a different American Catholicism from the Chicago of his birth'
summary: The new pope aligns with the tradition of social Catholicism, standing in stark contrast to the interpretation given by the White House and by Vice President JD Vance, who are fueling the fire of fundamentalism and illiberalism, analyzes Massimo Faggioli, a professor of religious studies.

title: After the ceasefire, lessons from the worst India-Pakistan clash in 20 years
summary: At the urging of the Americans, the two belligerents agreed to cease hostilities on Saturday, May 10. However, gunfire and explosions continued along the borderline in Kashmir.

title: In Phnom Penh, the French Embassy commemorates the tragedy of April 1975
summary: On May 8, 1975, the French diplomatic mission in Cambodia closed its doors after failing to protect hundreds of Cambodians who had sought refuge there.

title: In Paris, stuffed dough dishes go far beyond ravioli and dumplings: Here are Le Monde's five favorites
summary: Whether it's Georgian khinkali, Chinese guotie or Ukrainian varenyky, the French capital offers a world tour of various ingredients cooked in dough.

title: Coffee connoisseur Farimah Fattahi brings a touch of Iran to Paris's café culture
summary: The 32-year-old Tehran-born woman, who trained in the best Paris establishments, opened Harvest coffee shop in November 2024.

title: During Paris neo-fascist march: 'How can such things be allowed?'
summary: Initially banned by the police before being authorized by the administrative court, the march unfolded in a tense atmosphere in the Montparnasse neighborhood, under the protection of riot police.

title: Pope Leo XIV calls for peace in Ukraine and Gaza
summary: In his second public appearance, the new pope urged for a 'just and lasting peace' in Ukraine and a ceasefire in Gaza as tens of thousands gathered in St Peter's Square.

title: Capybaras are the new social media stars
summary: In a matter of months, the South American rodent has become a favorite animal on TikTok and Instagram. Yet, beneath its plush-like appearance, this herbivore, which can weigh up to 65 kilograms and reach 1.40 meters in length, turns out to be much more aggressive than it seems.

title: Iran, US kick off fourth round of nuclear talks as Tehran insists enrichment is 'non-negotiable'
summary: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi hailed enrichment as a national achievement. Washington has maintained that Iran's enrichment facilities have to be dismantled.

title: Should grandparents follow their children's instructions when babysitting?
summary: When taking care of their grandchildren, it's not always easy for grandparents to balance the parents' demands with the joy of letting themselves take some liberties, writes Le Monde parenting columnist Clara Georges.

title: War in Ukraine: Macron says Putin's proposal is 'not enough' without ceasefire
summary: The French leader called the Kremlin's bid for direct negotiations a delay tactic, reiterating demands for a 30‑day unconditional truce.

title: 'Macron and his prime minister clash over two conceptions of the referendum as a political tool'
summary: While Prime Minister François Bayrou considers using referendums to deal with France's public finances, President Emmanuel Macron envisages a less dramatic use of this tool, writes Le Monde politicial columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Pope Leo XIV 's first Sunday prayer hints at shift from Francis on war in Ukraine
summary: The new pope called for a 'genuine, just and lasting peace' between Kyiv and Moscow on Sunday. Francis had more often urged immediate peace and asked Ukraine to show 'the courage of the white flag.'

title: The foretold disaster of Israel's plan for humanitarian aid in Gaza
summary: Israel plans to entrust food deliveries to private security companies to prevent Hamas from diverting shipments. Industry professionals are concerned about the risk of militarizing aid and exacerbating inequalities.

title: Steven Spielberg, guardian of Holocaust memory
summary: The American director set out in the 1990s to collect testimonies from all Holocaust survivors. To date, the foundation he created for this purpose has gathered over 56,000 testimonies worldwide.

title: Inside Shein's sweatshops in Guangzhou: 'It's an extreme capitalist race'
summary: Le Monde visited several workshops producing millions of garments for the Chinese fast fashion giant. Employees and managers spoke about the harsh reality of an ultra-competitive system.

title: The magpie is indeed a thief, but also scared of new things
summary: A Norwegian experiment suggests that the presence of unexpected materials in nests, such as plastic or metal, could act as a scarecrow for corvids.

title: US-Israeli hostage's family says Edan Alexander will be released from Gaza 'in the coming days'
summary: Hamas said it would release a US-Israeli hostage held in Gaza as the group revealed it was engaged in direct talks with the United States towards a ceasefire in the war-battered territory.

title: Qatar says no final decision made on gifting Trump a jet to use as Air Force One
summary: The US Constitution's Emoluments Clause bars anyone holding government office from accepting any present, emolument, office or title from any 'King, Prince, or foreign State,' without congressional consent.

title: How a piece of André Breton's studio moved from Paris to Metz
summary: It took 20 days to transfer 255 objects from André Breton's studio from Beaubourg in Paris to the Centre Pompidou-Metz near the German border. The collection has been on display since May 8 in an exhibition curated by the artist Maurizio Cattelan.
